Class Move

  • java.lang.Object
    • Move
  • public class Move
extends Object
    Represents a single move that can be taken by a character. A move can result in stat changes (such as deducting the target's HP) and has certain probabilities of successfully occuring. A move can also make a target change its status.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private String name
      Player-visible name of the Move
      private double probability
      Probability, from 0.0 (0%) to 1.0 (100%), of attack (strength) being dealt successfully.
      private int statusEffect
      The status effect that can be invoked on opponent when Move is dealt
      private double statusProbability
      Probability, from 0.0 (0%) to 1.0 (100%), of status effect being dealt on opponent successfully.
      private int strength
      The strength (in Entity health) of the move.

    • Field Detail

      • statusEffect

        private int statusEffect
        The status effect that can be invoked on opponent when Move is dealt

      • strength

        private int strength
        The strength (in Entity health) of the move. Positive value will add to self health, negative value will subtract from opponent's health

      • probability

        private double probability
        Probability, from 0.0 (0%) to 1.0 (100%), of attack (strength) being dealt successfully.

      • statusProbability

        private double statusProbability
        Probability, from 0.0 (0%) to 1.0 (100%), of status effect being dealt on opponent successfully.

      • name

        private String name
        Player-visible name of the Move

    • Constructor Detail

      • Move

        public Move​(int se,
            int s,
            double p,
            double sp,
            String n)
        Parameters:
        se - the move's status effect
        s - the move's strength (negative for attack, positive for cure)
        p - the move's probability (0.0 to 1.0) of dealing damage/cure as per s
        sp - the move's probability (0.0 to 1.0) of dealing status effect as per se
        n - the name of the move

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        public String getName()

      • setProbability

        public void setProbability​(double p)

      • setStatusProbability

        public void setStatusProbability​(double sp)

      • getProbability

        public double getProbability()

      • getStatusProbability

        public double getStatusProbability()

      • deal

        public int[] deal()
        Gives an attack's result in the form of an array, accounting for probability
        Returns:
        a two-element int array where first element represents damage performed (negative implies damage to opponent, positive implies cure to self) and second element represents status effect
